oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: UNICEF tour - Tokyo, Japan - 1972 - part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part three of a 1972 UNICEF fundraiser tour performance in Tokyo, Japan at Budo Kahn Hall. Featuring Bruce Reynolds (announcer), John Kinney (announcer), Tex Ritter (host), Freddy Weller (performer), Glenn Barber (performer), and Leroy Van Dyke (interviewee).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Glenn Barber; Freddy Weller
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening theme and statement (Bruce Reynolds) -- (00:30) Reynolds introduces the cast of the show and UNICEF's sponsorship -- (1:05) Reynolds introduces Leroy Van Dyke -- Leroy Van Dyke thanks Reynolds and talks about how the show came about -- (01:55) Van Dyke talks about being active in the Country Music Association -- (02:40) Van Dyke talks about how the Country Music Association came to be along with some history -- (03:45) Van Dyke talks about the various efforts of the CMA -- (04:30) Van Dyke talks about who is eligible to be a part of the CMA -- (04:55) Van Dyke talks about the UNICEF tour and how he thinks it is the single most important event to happen in the far east for country music, and all those involved -- (05:57) Van Dyke talks about artists possibly touring in these parts of the world in the future -- (06:48) Van Dyke talks about the experience in New Zealand and how successful the shows were -- (07:28) Van Dyke talks about doing a TV spot in Tokyo the day before, with a Japanese choir backing up Van Dykes song in the segment -- (08:12) Van Dyke talks about his plans when he returns to the U.S. -- (08:57) Van Dyke talks about living in Nashville -- (09:15) Van Dyke talks about the amount of time he spends touring each year -- Van Dyke concludes the interview -- (10:00) John Kinney talks about the massive crown outside the event at Budo Kahn Hall -- (10:37) Kinney talks about the auction that was going on during Van Dykes interview and UNICEF's 25th anniversary -- (11:30) Kinney introduces the start of the show -- (11:43) Reynolds introduces Tex Ritter -- (12:32) Tex Ritter thanks the audience and introduces the cast -- Ritter introduces Glenn Barber -- (13:37) Glenn Barber introduces the first tune -- (13:55) Don't Worry About The Mule, Just Load The Wagon (Glenn Barber) -- (16:38) Barber thanks the audience and introduces the next tune -- (16:53) Kissed By The Rain (Glenn Barber) -- (19:48) Barber thanks the audience and talks about country music and introduces the next tune -- (20:47) My Woman, My Woman, My Wife (Glenn Barber) -- (24:32) Ritter thanks Glenn and introduces the last tune -- (25:10) Alabama Jubilee (Glenn Barber) -- (28:20) Ritter introduces Freddy Weller -- (29:00) The Promised Land (Freddy Weller) -- (31:45) Weller thanks the audience and introduces the next tune -- (31:50) Okie From Muskogee (Freddy Weller)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: UNICEF.; Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Weller, Freddy, 1947-; Barber, Glenn; Van Dyke, Leroy, 1929-;
